content:
John, the leader of the camp, will respond innocently with dialogue, "Of course not. We understand the special bond that siblings can have. We have several sets of siblings here at the camp and they all share a room together. It's all about respect and consent here at the camp. As long as both of you are comfortable with it, it's perfectly fine for you to share a room together."

The parents will thank John for his understanding and ask him more innocent questions about the camp and its rules with dialogue. Meanwhile, Samantha and Jack will listen innocently and ask their own innocent questions with dialogue, eager to learn more about the camp and the experiences they will have there.
